text: Just catching up on all the logo talk. LOVE what you guys came up with. Major kudos to everyone that contributed!
Also, I’m hoping to jump in and contribute to some of the open issues. Any that you feel are higher priority than others?

as far as high priority if you go to the milestones page on github any issues there are the highest priority for the project.

Doesn’t mean that the others aren’t necessary just means those are what we feel are necessary to get to version 1

I’m actually going to update the milestones. the priorities are still basically the same, just some items will move to version 1.1
as it will help people visualize the roadmap for the framework a lot easier.

*Version 1.0* the main thing there will be the grid, and file structure.

At this point the framework will be bare bones but will be usable for production sites. Getting a stable production ready grid and good foundational structure in place is the most important thing for it to be useful for developers.

*Version 1.1 - Components*

We will focus on adding components like bootstrap and foundation have.

*Version 1.2*
Still TBD but maybe focusing on performance and SEO related stuff is a good idea

At each version we’ll try to create a doc explaining how to migrate a site up the versions.
this restructuring of the milestones gets us to stable usable builds faster, and creates clear guides for the major releases of the framework.

Finished re-labeling all GitHub issues into these milestones. Everything with v1.0 milestone is the highest priority by far.

That doesn’t mean you can’t work on the other parts, you can, the version 1.0 parts are just the most important.
well aren't you a busy bee today

If anyone disagrees with how this should be done or whatnot, create an issue, and tag me on it, and explain why. I’ll always listen, this isn’t a dictatorship. I’m just trying to project manage and keep us moving forward, so I AM making quick executive decisions. Putting everything up for discussion makes things slower, doesn’t mean we can’t do it. Just running on the philosophy getting something done is better than 3 months from now having only discussed getting things done. As well as having something to improve, is usually easier than starting with a blank canvas.

Version 1.0 is a big deal and will help spur adoption because it will be the first stable release and draw attention to a lot of good practices in HubSpot development.

So, on this long weekend, if you’re itchin’ to do some codin’.
We’ve got issues, yes, yes we do.
<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft/milestone/1>
